newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian VSM Railways see bond issue.
newsitem.headline: Russian VSM Railways see bond issue.

text.p: Russia's RAO Vysokoskorostnye Magistrali (VSM or High-Speed Railways) plans to issue a 150 billion rouble ($26.4 million) one-year government-backed bond on March 20, a company official said on Wednesday.
The bonds will be traded on the Moscow Interbank Currency Exchange and the central bank will be the general agent, financial director Andrei Nikandrov told Reuters.
VSM is raising funds to build a high-speed railway from Moscow to St. Petersburg.
The issue will be VSM's third. Its bonds are Russia's only government-backed corporate paper.
The securities are effectively the same as Russian OFZ interest-bearing bonds. OFZ bonds pay quarterly interest linked to current issues of GKO discount Treasury bills.
VSM's first two bond issues amounted to 120 billion and 240 billion roubles.
Environmentalists oppose the multi-billion dollar project as the route is supposed to cross several national parks.
